We will continue to monitor the storm and will publish any updates on its forecast path and intensity.

Anyone who needs assistance, please call our OEP at (337) 394-2208.

Effective Friday, May 1, 2020, the public parks, under the administration of St. Martin Parish Government, will be re-opened for public use including the children’s playground equipment. Social distancing in all areas SHALL APPLY, and the 10-person limitation rule (parent and children) shall apply to the playground equipment. All pavilions at the Parks shall remain closed.

All tennis courts, basketball courts, volleyball courts, and ball fields shall also remain closed.

The outdoor activities now being allowed at our Parks pose no COVID-19 health risks according to the medical community. Indeed, at his press conference on Monday, Governor John Bel Edwards encouraged citizens to get outdoors and exercise. See you at the track!

Visit https://my2020census.gov/ and fill out one single form for your whole household - even if you aren't related, but still living together.

These closures are necessary to allow crews to make attenuator repairs.

Emergency vehicles will have access to the area but may encounter delays.

The $124.7 million I-10 widening project will involve widening a 7.11-mile section from I-49 to Breaux Bridge (State Project Number H.003003). The project will include pavement replacement within the existing lanes and the construction of one additional lane in each direction along I-10 from I-49 to LA 328 (Breaux Bridge).

The project began in May 2017 and is estimated for completion in September 2020.

August 15, 2019 at 4:25 PM ·

ARE YOU LOOKING TO GET RID OF OLD FURNITURE??

The Fire District is looking for old furniture to use in our training props. We are looking for chars, dining sets, mattresses. **No Sofas**

We are also looking for kids toys such as outdoor play-sets, pack-n-plays, cribs.

They do not have to be in the best condition, we just ask that they are intact, not water logged so they can be moved around, and able to add an element of realism to our trainings.

We are striving to add as many elements of real materials to our 'Fire Simulations" so the men and women of our Fire District can simulate the most accurate conditions and scenarios when training.

If you have anything that you would like to donate please contact the St. Martin Parish Fire District Office through Facebook Messenger or by phone: (337) 332-1314

The project began in May 2017 and is estimated for completion in April 2020.

The project began in July 2017 and is estimated for completion in 2020.

Parish Government will commence the collection of storm debris from Hurricane Barry on Thursday, July 25, 2019. Therefore, all residents should place the yard waste generated by the storm at the edge of their property. Yard waste is defined as logs, plants, tree branches, and similar vegetation matter. Please note:

▪ All large tree trunks should be cut or trimmed as much as practical.

▪ All yard waste (logs, plants, and tree branches) must be segregated from all other waste such as household waste, construction debris, and white goods.

▪ Make sure all debris is placed on the edge of your property so that it does not encroach upon any street or road or drainage laterals.

The Louisiana Department of Transportation and Development has announced the right lane of I-10 eastbound from mile marker 107 (LA 31 overpass) to mile marker 109 (LA 328 Off-Ramp) will be closed on Friday, June 28, from 8 p.m. to 6 a.m., weather permitting.

This closure is necessary to repair a damaged crash attenuator.

The alternate route for traffic is I-49 northbound to US 190 back to I-10 eastbound.

Emergency vehicles will not have access to the area during the closure due to no shoulder on either side of the roadway. No detour.

The $124.7 million I-10 widening project will involve widening a 7.11-mile section from I-49 to Breaux Bridge (State Project Number H.003003). The project will include pavement replacement within the existing lanes and the construction of one additional lane in each direction along I-10 from I-49 to LA 328 (Breaux Bridge).

The project began in May 2017 and is estimated for completion in fall 2019.
